title: Shades of Winter Knitting (gnv64)
description:
Shades of Winter: Knitting with Natural Wool 
by Ingalill Johansson and Ewa Andinsson
Interweave Press | November 2012 | ISBN-10:159668786X | PDF | 159 pages | 19.1 mb <a href="
http://www.amazon.com/Shades-Winter-Knitting-Natural-Wool/dp/159668786X" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.amazon.com/Shades-Winter-Knitting-Natural-Wool/dp/159668786X</a>

Inspired by the sublime, subtle tones of wintry northern landscapes, the more than 35 projects in Shades of Winter showcase the natural beauty of pure undyed wool yarn photographed against the Scandinavian winterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s snow crystals and cold.
These gorgeous garmentsÃ¢â‚¬â€from tops, sweaters, dresses, and coats to hats, mittens, scarves, and shawlsÃ¢â‚¬â€evoke woolÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s warmth and softness in many different patterns and textures. A knitter of any skill level and inclination will surely become enchanted by the possibilities: garments ranging from simple garter and stockinette to more elaborate cables, bobbles, texture, and lace patterns.
Knitting with eco-friendly undyed wool creates a rich, visually organic theme for the book. The chapters are organized by the natural tones of the yarns: white, gray, and beige. These fine woolens are not only visually stunning, but hold the promise of doing no harm to the environment.
Knitters will be transported by the bookÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s artful photography, taken in one of SwedenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most exotic and famous locations, the Ice Hotel in JukkasjÃƒÂ¤rvi. Here, stylish knits are viewed in a dreamlike atmosphere, where ice columns and ice crystal crowns in the pillared hall range in color from the iciest light blue to the deepest petroleum blue. The only shivers a knitter will feel are those of pure delight at the contrast of woolen warmth next to icy environs.
Like a modern fairy tale, Shades of Winter will captivate any knit

About the Authors
Ingalill Johansson is the chief designer and quality manager for one of SwedenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s largest knitting companies. During her more than 30 years of experience in the industry, she has worked for all of SwedenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s major knitting companies, has been a freelance designer, and has created many patterns for weekly publications. Ingalill runs her own yarn store in Gothenburg and this is her first book. She lives in Sweden.
Ewa K. Andinsson runs two successful businesses, Andinsson Photography and a publishing company, Andina FÃƒÂ¶rlagher. Her knitting book Stickat i ekologiskull is extremely popular with local audiences. Ewa lives in Sweden.
